qas.question: What is the average amount lived on per day?

answers.text: by purely market-based means, simply by exporting its main commodity of comparative advantage — cheap labor

qas.question: What has been one of the drivers of Tajikistan's robust economic growth?
Ninety percent of the population lives on less then what?
Migration from Turkey has been unprecedented in what?
Who has achieved a transition from a market to a planned economy?

plausible_answers.text: of the drivers of Tajikistan's robust economic growth

qas.question: Remittances have not played an important role as what?
What has not helped reduce poverty?

context: According to some estimates about 20% of the population lives on less than <a0_0><b4_0>US$1.25 per day<b4_0/><a0_0/>. Migration from Tajikistan and the consequent remittances have been unprecedented in their <b5_0>magnitude and economic impact<b5_0/>. In 2010, remittances from Tajik labour migrants totaled an <a1_0>estimated $2.1 billion US dollars<a1_0/>, an increase from 2009. <b6_0>Tajikistan<b6_0/> has achieved transition from a planned to a market economy without substantial and protracted recourse to aid (of which it by now receives only negligible amounts), and <a2_0>by purely market-based means, simply by exporting its main commodity of comparative advantage — cheap labor<a2_0/>. The World Bank Tajikistan Policy Note 2006 concludes that <a3_0><b8_0>remittances<b8_0/><a3_0/> have played an important role as one <b7_0>of the drivers of Tajikistan's robust economic growth<b7_0/> during the past several years, have increased incomes, and as a result helped significantly reduce poverty.
